At that time, there was a comet appearing in the country, which was an evil omen.

Since this star has appeared, for twelve years the country will experience a severe drought without any rain from heaven, and it will not be possible to plant crops. The country will certainly be destroyed.
At that time, there was an elder in the country named Santan, whose family was extremely wealthy with immeasurable wealth and grain. He always prepared offerings to provide for the ascetics.
At that time, the thousand sages went to his house, seeking offerings, and said:
We people are staying in that mountain, but the country is experiencing a severe drought. It is difficult to beg for food. Elder, if you can provide us with food, we will stay here;
if you do not give, we will go to other places.
The elder then asked the steward of the granary:
Do we have enough grain in our storehouses to feed all these great beings?
I wish to invite them.
The steward replied:
Please invite them at once. We have plenty of grain to provide for them.
The elder then invited a thousand pratyekabuddhas to offer them food and service.
The remaining thousand people also went to his house, seeking offerings.
The elder again asked the steward of the granary:
How much grain and food do we have in our storehouses?
There are another thousand people who also wish to make offerings. Will it be enough to provide for them?
The steward said:
The grain and food in our charge will certainly be sufficient. If you wish to make offerings, you may invite them at once.
At that time, the elder immediately invited them.
He assigned five hundred servants to prepare the food and service.
At that time, the servants who were in charge of preparing the food, after many years of hard work, became weary and said:
The reason why we are all so exhausted is because of these beggars.
At that time, the elder always had one person inform when it was time.
At that time, the servant raised a puppy. Whenever he went to inform the time, the puppy would follow him. It was like this every day.
At that time, the servant suddenly forgot one day and did not go to inform. When the time came, the puppy went to its usual place alone and barked loudly at the great beings.
The pratyekabuddhas heard the dog barking and immediately knew it was time for the invitation. They then went to the house and received the food according to the Dharma.
They then informed the elder:
The heavens will rain now, so you should plant.
The elder did as he was told, and had the workers bring their tools and diligently plow and plant wheat, barley, and all kinds of edible grains.
After some time, all the crops they planted turned into gourds.
Seeing this, the elder was puzzled and asked about it.
The great beings said:
There's nothing to worry about. Just put in more effort and water them in a timely manner.
As they were told, they diligently watered them. Later, when they matured, the gourds were all huge and even more abundant.
They cut them open and saw that according to what they had planted, they had turned into clean and well-harvested wheat, filling the gourds.
The elder was delighted. His entire household stored the harvest, filling their house to overflowing. They also shared it with their relatives and the entire country, who all received its blessings.
At that time, the five hundred people who prepared the food thought:
The fruits and rewards we have obtained are due to the kindness of these great beings.
How could we speak ill of him?
They went to him and asked for forgiveness.
The great man listened and accepted their repentance. After they had repented, they made a vow, saying:
We wish that in future lives, we will encounter sages and attain liberation.
Because of this, for five hundred lifetimes, they were always beggars;
Because of their repentance and vow, they now encountered me in this world and attained liberation.
Prince, you should know!
Is the greatly wealthy one who gave generously then someone else?
It is I myself.
The treasurer then is now Sudatta.
The one who went every day to announce the time is King Udayana.
The dog then, because of its barking, had a good voice and beautiful voice for lifetimes. It is the elder Upatiá¹£ya.
The five hundred people who cooked the food then are now these five hundred arhats.
